snippet: Russia has long lived in fear of a jihadist uprising within its own borders, particularly in the Caucasus where it fought two brutal wars to suppress Muslim separatists.
abstract: Russian government's crackdown on Muslim citizens causes Islam converts to flee, escaping near-constant surveillance and violent scrutiny; Russian stance is fueled by historic fear of separatist extremism and challenges to Orthodox Christian national identity that Pres Vladimir Putin has used to unite a post-Soviet Communism population.
lead_paragraph: Russia has long lived in fear of a jihadist uprising within its own borders, particularly in the Caucasus where it fought two brutal wars to suppress Muslim separatists.
